meanings.definition: The art of creating theatrical scenery.
meanings.sent1: The school play's scenography was done beautifully by the students.
meanings.sent2: The scenography for the Broadway show was breathtaking and immersive.
meanings.sent3: The scenography for the comedy play had the audience laughing before the actors even came on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast canvas, with thoughts and memories forming the intricate scenography of her life.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the scenography of the forest with such detail that you could almost smell the pine trees.

meanings.definition: The design and arrangement of scenery in a play or performance.
meanings.sent1: The scenography of the set made the audience feel like they were in a different world.
meanings.sent2: The director's attention to scenography brought the story to life on stage.
meanings.sent3: The mismatched scenography in the play gave it a quirky charm.
meanings.sent4: The scenography of the stage transformed into a magical kingdom as the lights dimmed.
meanings.sent5: The scenography of the play was so realistic that you could almost reach out and touch the painted backdrop.
